elements.content: H2Onitrogen11812881285938114† CCDC reference numbers 641198–641200. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b707579kcrystallographic data‡ Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: Full NMR spectroscopic and crystallographic data for complexes 1–3. See DOI: 10.1039/b707579kNMRcrystallographic data§ Synthesis of 1: a stirred solution of [(AuCl)2(dppbz)] (1′) (its synthetic procedure can be found in the electronic supplementary information, ESI‡) (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane was treated with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light. The AgCl precipitate was filtered through Celite. Diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.2185 g (93.4 %). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into a CH2Cl2 solution of 1; mp 220–226 °C. 1H NMR (399.9 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 7.22–7.32 (m, 2H), 7.39–7.50 (m, 16H), 7.52–7.56 (m, 4H), 7.56–7.62 (m, 2H). 31P{1H} NMR (161.890 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 20.1 (s). Synthesis of 2: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1′ (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 4,4’-bipyridyl (0.034 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. After stirring of 5 h, diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.444 g (82.75%). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into a mother liquor of 2; mp 162–166 °C. Solid-state 31P{1H} MAS (242.769 MHz, 25 °C, 16 kHz) δ 21.3. Synthesis of 3: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1′ (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 1,2-trans-bis(4-pyridyl)-ethylene (0.04 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. After stirring of 5 h, diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.445 g (81.2 %). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into dichloromethane solution of 3; mp 150–154 °C. Solution 1H NMR (399.909 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C) δ 7.24-7.33 (m, 2H), 7.39 (s, 2H), 7.41–7.52 (m, 16H), 7.56–7.70 (m, 10H), 8.46–8.53 (d, J = 6.2 Hz, 4H). Solution 31P{1H} NMR (161.890 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 20.29 (s).

Synthesis of 2: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1' (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 4,4'-bipyridyl (0.034 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into a mother liquor of 2; mp 162-166 °C. Solid-state 31P{1H} MAS (242.769 MHz, 25 °C, 16 kHz) δ 21.3. Synthesis of 3: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1' (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 1,2-trans-bis(4-pyridyl)-ethylene (0.04 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. Solution 31P{1H} NMR (161.890 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 20.29 (s).

elements.content: dichloromethaneDiethyl etherdichloromethanediethyl ethern-hexane1H NMRNMRdichloromethane4,4’-bipyridyldichloromethanediethyl etherdichloromethanediethyl ethern-hexanedichloromethanedichloromethanediethyl etherdichloromethanediethyl ethern-hexane1H NMRNMR¶ Single crystal X-ray diffraction: Rigaku R-axis Rapid diffractometer. Crystal data for complex 1: C34H24Au2F6O4P2, 2(CH2Cl2); M = 1236.26, triclinic, a = 12.143(4), b = 12.325(4), c = 13.869(4) Å, α = 99.008(12), β = 96.572(12), γ = 95.481(13)°, V = 2022.9(11) Å3, T = 153 K, space group P (no. 2), Z = 2, μ(Mo-Kα) = 7.652 mm−1, 59040 reflections collected, 7151 unique (Rint = 0.116) which were used in all calculations. R1 = 0.0558, wR(F2) = 0.1424 (all data). Crystal data for complex 2: 2(C20H16AuNP), 2(C2F3O2), CH2Cl2; M= 1307.52, tetragonal, a = b = 19.827(2), c = 22.206(3) Å, V = 8729.4(17) Å3, T = 103 K, space group I2d (no. 122), Z = 8, μ(Mo-Kα) = 6.983 mm−1, 131109 reflections collected, 3866 unique (Rint = 0.128) which were used in all calculations. R1 = 0.0634, wR(F2) = 0.1371 (all data), Flack parameter = 0.04(2). Crystal data for complex 3: C84H68Au4N4P4, 4(C2F3O2), 2(CH2Cl2), 4(H2O); M = 2739.17, monoclinic, a = 10.0634(14), b = 21.126(3), c = 22.728(4) Å, β = 100.424(6)°, V = 4752.2(13) Å3, T = 123 K, space group P21/c (no. 14), Z = 2, μ(Mo-Kα) = 6.421 mm−1, 114260 reflections collected, 8324 unique (Rint = 0.079) which were used in all calculations. R1 = 0.0386, wR(F2) = 0.0841 (all data). CCDC reference numbers 641198–641200. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b707579k

metadata.title: Self-assembly of gold( i ) with diphosphine and bitopic nitrogen donor linkers in the presence of trifluoroacetate anion: formation of coordination polymer  versus discrete macrocycle
